terms.definition: A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
Application Programming Interface - a set of rules that allows different software applications to communicate with each other
Security Assertion Markup Language/Single Sign-On - authentication protocols that allow users to access multiple applications with one set of login credentials
A lightweight markup language that uses plain text formatting syntax to create formatted documents
JSON Web Token - a secure method of transmitting information between parties as a digitally signed token for user authentication
Software or infrastructure that is installed and runs on computers within an organization's physical location rather than in the cloud
A cloud computing environment dedicated exclusively to a single organization, providing enhanced security and control
A personalized web address that organizations can use instead of default platform URLs to maintain brand consistency
Secure Sockets Layer - a security protocol that creates an encrypted connection between a web server and browser
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to revert to previous versions
The process of integrating documentation or widgets directly into websites or applications using code snippets
A rich text editor framework for React applications that provides extensible and customizable text editing capabilities
What You See Is What You Get - an editor that displays content exactly as it will appear in the final published format
terms.expanded: What You See Is What You Get

terms.definition: Interactive guided walkthroughs that help users navigate and understand software features and functionality
AI-powered automated translation feature that converts documentation content into multiple languages without manual intervention
